Perhaps they ought to go without Early Sales for May and make the Early Sales for June (and each month thereon) take place the first weekend of the month to squelch the seemingly widespread misunderstanding of what's meant by "Early."

its almost like the early means "Earlier than usually scheduled" and not "Sale occurring in Early [Month]". There's always going to be misunderstandings though of course, with such a large playerbase especially one so full of preteens.

Sure, it's not that hard a thing to understand. At the same time, though, why make things conflict with fairly natural intuitions? A lot more things in life could be designed to take into account our irrational brains.
New skins usually go on sale a year after their original release, and an early sale is just a chance to get the skin at a discounted price before the actual sale.

They're called "early" sales because they've been released so recently that they've never been on sale before. So this is them on sale before they should be, hence the reduced discount price (25%, 23%, etc.)
